neutral.translation[0].definitions[0].de: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement
neutral.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
neutral.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a country that is neutral does not support any of the countries involved in a war
neutral.translation[0].definitions[1].no: neutral territory/waters (=land or sea that is not controlled by any of the countries involved in a war)
neutral.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: During World War II, Sweden was neutral.
neutral.translation[0].definitions[2].de: language, words etc that are neutral are deliberately chosen to avoid expressing any strong opinion or feeling
neutral.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: the neutral language of an official news report
neutral.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if someone says something in a neutral voice, or if they have a neutral expression on their face, they do not show how they are feeling
neutral.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Bragg said in a neutral voice, ‘The investigation has been closed down.’
neutral.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a neutral colour is a colour such as grey, light brown, or cream
neutral.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Neutral tones give the room a feeling of space.
neutral.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a neutral wire, for example in a plug, has no electrical charge1(7)
neutral.translation[0].definitions[6].de: a neutral substance is neither acid nor alkaline
neutral.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: The plant prefers a neutral or slightly acidic soil.
neutral.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the position of the gears of a car or machine when no power is being sent from the engine to the wheels or other moving parts
neutral.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: When you start the engine, make sure the car’s in neutral.
neutral.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a country, person, or group that is not involved in an argument or disagreement
